Line 99: Line 99:
==Reception==
==Reception==
  +
<!--
  +
###############
  +
####NOTICE#####
  +
###############
  +
Be careful with the reviews or similar material you add. They should only be sourced to reliable/trusted organizations and should be presented in a neutral way. "Original research" is not allowed, meaning you can't describe your own experiences neither advance conclusions beyond what is in the sources.
  +
Both negative and positive reactions should be included, assuming they comply with wikipedia policies/guidelines (and common sense)
  +
It is also a good idea to discuss the changes on the talk page if you are unsure if they are appropriate to the article
  +
-->
According to [[Engadget]] editor Darren Murph, the Galaxy Nexus was "smooth as ever. Without question, this is easily the slickest, most polished version of Android yet"<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/google-ice-cream-sandwich-android-4-0-a-hands-on-screenshot-g/ Google Ice Cream Sandwich (Android 4.0): a hands-on screenshot gallery - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and that "The entire experience just felt polished. In a way, it's as if Android's growing a bit and maturing before our eyes".<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on (video) - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
According to [[Engadget]] editor Darren Murph, the Galaxy Nexus was "smooth as ever.
